sense.name: The physical brochure describing the details of a presentation or sporting event.
sense.examples: The programme this year was small and flimsy. You can't tell the players without a programme.

sense.name: An integrated course of academic studies.
sense.examples: He was admitted to a new programme at the University. My programme is highly competetive.

sense.name: (computer science) a sequence of instructions that a computer can interpret and execute.
sense.examples: The programme required several hundred lines of code. I can't get my programme to run.

sense.name: A system of projects, services, or steps that lead to a (public) goal.
sense.examples: The President has initiated a programme of reform. They drew up a six-step programme.

sense.name: A performance or show.
sense.examples: Did you see his programme last night? The programme lasted for more than two hours.
